# Aubrey Clark

> Machine learning engineer. PhD Economics, Harvard (2017).

## About

Aubrey Clark builds machine learning systems and studies economics. Currently Staff Data Scientist & Technical Lead Manager at Google, Global Infrastructure. Previously: Twitter (ML/Performance), Wealthfront (automated financial advisory), University of Cambridge (Lecturer: Information Economics, Mechanism Design).

## Projects

- [Communication Systems from Scratch](https://github.com/abclark/communication_systems): Built the internet protocol stack from first principles â€” TCP/IP, QUIC, HTTP/3, Protocol Buffers, BGP, BBR congestion control, and an audio modem that transmits TCP packets as sound through air.
- [Probabilistic Serial Mechanism](https://github.com/abclark/probabilistic_serial_mechanism): Fair allocation algorithm. pip installable.
- [Constrained Birkhoff-von Neumann](https://github.com/abclark/constrained_birkhoff_von_neumann): Implementation of Budish-Che-Kojima-Milgrom (2013) algorithm for constrained random assignment.
- [Cycle Finder](https://github.com/abclark/cycle_finder): Monien (1985) path-finding algorithm.

## Research

- [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=JEBueQ8AAAAJ)
- Dissertation: "Dynamic Allocation, Selection, and Hypothesis-Testing" (Harvard, 2017). Committee chair: Eric Maskin.
